title: Communication Skills - Group Work and Networking
headline: Learn effective communication strategies for building relationships, conflict management, group work, and networking.
description: This free online Communication Skills course teaches about group work and networking. Any relationship can experience conflict at some point in time. With this course, you will learn the role of communication in building and maintaining relationships. You will study the theories of group dynamics, the main types of groups, verbal and non-verbal communication strategies and conflict-handling styles, and the importance of having a social network.
courseDescription:
This course will teach you how to maintain important relationships through communication. You will first study the different types of relationships which include deep, moderate, casual, and passing. You will study the different stages of a relationship, the differences between groups and teams, and the factors that affect group behavior. You will also look into the 5 stages of group development.

Conflicts are often viewed negatively and people try to avoid them, but the reality is that conflict is inevitable. This course will first discuss group conflict and teach you different conflict-handling styles. You will study the five types of conflicts, which include intrapersonal, interpersonal, intragroup, intergroup, and international. You will also learn both verbal and nonverbal communication strategies. This course will then cover the importance of human interaction and conversational skills in networking.

Group members with a strong relationship will respect each other’s opinions and come up with a solution for each conflict that benefits everybody. This course will give you a better understanding of the most effective ways to work in a group. These skills will directly enhance both your personal and professional life, and give you the conflict handling abilities you need to make life that little bit less stressful. These are great skills, so check out the course today and start learning something really useful.

• The key points from this module are:
  • Communication plays a vital role in building relationships. 
    Every relationship has problems and conflicts; this is human nature and it is not always clear why relationships have difficulties.
    A relationship is like a machine, like a machine from time-to-time relationships require maintenance; this is achieved through communication. 
    Relationships are vital for survival and to feel safe. 
    Humans seek relationships and contact, even with animals such as pets. 
    Relationships play an important role in your life.
    There are several characteristics which help to define relationships.
    Relationships are subject to human problems, many times we have to have relationships with others.

    Types of relationships
    There are four different types of relationship; deep, moderate, casual, and passing. 
    A passing relationship is when individuals see each other often in their lives and develop a relationship mentally, despite never having talked to the other person.
    A casual relationship is when people meet and have a basic conversation, such as talking to the person next to you on a flight, and the relationship concludes when you go your opposite ways.
    A moderate relationship often occurs in your work life; they include a lot of formalities and small talk.
    Relationships can evolve and change over time; from casual to moderate, or from moderate to casual. 
    A deep relationship is between two very close people, such as between husband and wife.

• The key points from this module are:
  • Conflicts
    Conflicts are often viewed in a very negative light and people try to avoid it, but the reality is that conflict is inevitable. 

    Deutsch (1971) claimed that ‘Conflict exists whenever incompatible activities occur’.

    A conflict can be viewed as a positive, from which new ideas and concepts can emerge. 
    Group communication is all about everyday talk and relationships, especially the relationships between people. Relationships matter a lot in the functioning of a group. 
    When conflict occurs in a group it should be seen as a battle between people who have ideas rather than a battle of ideas. 

    Managing conflict with communication
    If group members have a good relationship they will respect each other’s opinions and come up with a solution that benefits everybody. 
    A group can promote its own decision making capacities by setting a definite agenda, doing a through problem analysis, assessing its goals, and assessing alternative possibilities. 

    Promotive communication and counteractive communication are ways to keep groups on task. 
    Proper communication and good relationships are vital in allowing a group to achieve its goal.
